note: Some regions of the world are will have experienced significant biodiversity loss prior to 1970, this earlier loss will not captured in this metric.
title: Living Planet Index by region
subtitle: The Living Planet Index (LPI) measures the average relative decline in monitored wildlife [populations](#dod:population). The index value measures the change in abundance in 38,427 populations across 5,268 species relative to the year 1970 (i.e. 1970 = 100%).
